history.desc: Give an account about the history of the manuscript and its owners. Distinguish between the previous owners ("Provenance"), and how it came into the present collection ("Acquisition").

valItem.desc: signals that the application's default white-space processing modes are acceptable アプリケーションがデフォルトで持つ空白文字類処理モードが有効であることを知らせる。
indicates the intent that applications preserve all white space アプリケーションがすべての空白文字類を保持するという意図を示す。

summary.desc: Outline your observations of the main historical facts of this manuscript or manuscript part.

provenance.desc: Give an account of how the manuscript passed into the hands of later owners using vestiges they left inside the manuscript or some external records. Use the appropriate fields to describe relevant persons, dates, etc.

date.desc: Fill in the date in the agreed-upon calendrical system. Use the "when" field for precise values. In case the date can only be approximated, use the "not After "and "not Before" fields together.

valItem.desc: Hebrew calendar
Era of Alexander of Macedon, year 1 = 319 BC
Islamic Era
Julian calendar

measurement applies to all instances. 측정은 모두 사례에 적용된다. 度量可應用於所有實例。 la medida se aplica a todos los casos. 全インスタンスに当てはまる単位。 la mesure s'applique à tous les cas. la misurazione fa riferimento a tutti i casi

measurement applies to most of the instances inspected. 측정은 대부분의 사례에 적용된다. 度量可應用於大部分實例。 la medida se aplica a la mayoría de los casos examinados. 計測インスタンスの殆どに当てはまる単位。 la mesure s'applique à la plupart des cas examinés la misurazione fa riferimento alla maggior parte dei casi esaminati

measurement applies to only the specified range of instances. 측정이 사례의 명시적 범위에 한정하여 적용된다. 度量僅應用於特定範圍的實例。 la medida se aplica solamente a los casos especificados 特定インスタンスにのみ当てはまる単位。 la mesure s'applique seulement à l'ensemble des exemples indiqués. la misurazione fa riferimento solo ai casi specificati
Age, the value should be given in a @dur attribute according to W3C datatypes
Duration of a reign, the value should be given in a @dur attribute according to W3C datatypes
Duration of life, the value should be given in a @dur attribute according to W3C datatypes
Duration of marriage, the value should be given in a @dur attribute according to W3C datatypes
Generic duration, the value should be given in a @dur attribute according to W3C datatypes
Date of foundation
Date of the composition of a work
Date of the translation of a work
Date of the revision of a work
Date of the composition of a specific recension
Date of a saint’s martyrdom
Date of birth (do not use this in a person record, use element birth)
Date of a person’s ascension to power
Date of death
The date of production of the document (EMA)
If the commemoration is repeated, please add this value as well in type
lines of text 텍스트의 행 líneas de texto テキスト行 lignes de texte righe di testo
characters of text 텍스트의 문자 caracteres del texto 文字列 caractères du texte caratteri di testo

p.desc: Enter prose text to connect the fields dedicated to specific elements and form a coherent descriptive text.

quote.desc: Quote from the manuscript. Use the "Language" field to specify the language.

locus.desc: Specify the location of a text or another feature within the manuscript. The "target" field is used for single folio. The "from" and "to" fields are used together to describe a range of folios.

persName.desc: Look up the person records in the database to identify the person. Try different spellings in different languages! If no suitable record exists, create a new one. (The "reference" field will be filled out automatically when you link a record to this element.)

valItem.desc: to be used only in person records, to idenfity a preferred option among the names provided.
the normalized transcription of the name in fidal or another script
name received later in life, different from the other specified types of names
name given at birth
name given at baptism
name given on coronation (kings and queens but also patriarchs)
name given on entering monastic life
the name of the battle horse of kings and rulers
a name given to a person associated to his occupation or other deeds
nom de guerre (if different from horse name, e.g. Malas)
short form (diminutive or abbreviated, e.g. Taklo for Takla Māryām)
father's name, esp. for eventual Russian names, but could be also highlighted in others
alternative name
the saint to whom the tābot is dedicated

signatures.desc: contains discussion of the leaf or quire signatures found within a codex or similar object.

valItem.desc: signals that the application's default white-space processing modes are acceptable アプリケーションがデフォルトで持つ空白文字類処理モードが有効であることを知らせる。
indicates the intent that applications preserve all white space アプリケーションがすべての空白文字類を保持するという意図を示す。

p.desc: Enter prose text to connect the fields dedicated to specific elements and form a coherent descriptive text.

stamp.desc: Describe the stamps left by libraries or other institutions, usually to mark manuscripts as their property.

placeName.desc: Look up the place records in the database to specify a settlement or town. Try different spellings in different languages! If no suitable record exists, create a new one. (The "reference" field will be filled out automatically when you link a place record to this element.)

acquisition.desc: Give an account of how the manuscript came into the collection where it is now held. Use the available fields to tag relevant persons, dates, etc.

placeName.desc: Look up the place records in the database to specify a settlement or town. Try different spellings in different languages! If no suitable record exists, create a new one. (The "reference" field will be filled out automatically when you link a place record to this element.)

date.desc: Fill in the date in the agreed-upon calendrical system. Use the "when" field for precise values. In case the date can only be approximated, use the "not After "and "not Before" fields together.

valItem.desc: Hebrew calendar
Era of Alexander of Macedon, year 1 = 319 BC
Islamic Era
Julian calendar

measurement applies to all instances. 측정은 모두 사례에 적용된다. 度量可應用於所有實例。 la medida se aplica a todos los casos. 全インスタンスに当てはまる単位。 la mesure s'applique à tous les cas. la misurazione fa riferimento a tutti i casi

measurement applies to most of the instances inspected. 측정은 대부분의 사례에 적용된다. 度量可應用於大部分實例。 la medida se aplica a la mayoría de los casos examinados. 計測インスタンスの殆どに当てはまる単位。 la mesure s'applique à la plupart des cas examinés la misurazione fa riferimento alla maggior parte dei casi esaminati

measurement applies to only the specified range of instances. 측정이 사례의 명시적 범위에 한정하여 적용된다. 度量僅應用於特定範圍的實例。 la medida se aplica solamente a los casos especificados 特定インスタンスにのみ当てはまる単位。 la mesure s'applique seulement à l'ensemble des exemples indiqués. la misurazione fa riferimento solo ai casi specificati
